creditline: Gift of funds from the Prints and Drawings Affinity Group
description: cream-colored leather cover; two pairs of green ties on outer edge; book of 43 engraved plates; artist's copy book with images of faces and facial features, feet, hands, arms and torsos
marks:
Inscriptions, signature, marks

Title page (1) : Signed

Plate with artist\'s studio (p. 2), at lo
text: This manual for artists follows the common pattern of focusing first on single parts of the body, then going on to more accomplished forms and compositions. Its author, the painter and printmaker Odoardo Fialetti, was familiar with the many illustrated medical treatises published in Venice in the 16th and early 17th century. Years later, he went on to collaborate with the anatomist Giulio Casseri, producing the plates for (Venice in 1627: on display here) which feature arresting images of flayed bodies in flirting attitudes.
title: Il vero modo et ordine per dissegnar tutte le parti et membra del corpo humano.
